section.p: The structure is used to collect concommitant and prior medications or therapies used by the study subject. Examples are concommitant medications or therapies given on an as-needed basis, and the usual and background medications or therapies given for a condition.

ol.li: SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="SBADM" (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 HL7ActClass)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] doseQuantity
The amount of medication taken at a single administration. [SDTM: CMDOSE, CMDOSU]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] effectiveTime
Information on when and how oftern the concommitant medication was taken. Possible values include start date, stop date, and duration. Note, only two of these need to be valued, and only two values are supported. [SDTM: CMSTDTC, CMENDTC, CMDUR, CMDOSFRQ]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] routeCode
The route by which the medication is administered. [SDTM: CMROUTE]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Allows capture of a group identifier for the concommitant medication information.
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Group Identifier (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.63)

SHALL contain [1..2] id
A sponsor supplied reference number for the concommitant medication. [SDTM: CMSEQ, CMSPID] A sequence number is required.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Indicates a category the concommitant medication substance administration is assigned to.
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @typeCode="COMP"
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] observation
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] value with data type CE
Provide the concomitant medication category value. [SDTM: CMCAT]
This observation MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
This entryRelationship SHALL contain zero or one [0..1] @typeCode="COMP"
This entryRelationship SHALL contain zero or one [0..1] observation
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="OBS" Observation (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 HL7ActClass)
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood)
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] value with data type CE
Provide the applicable concomitant medication sub-category value. [SDTM: CMSCAT]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Provides a reason for not capturing information for the concomitant medication.
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Non Performance Reason (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.64)

SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] statusCode
Used to indicate whether the activity - use of a particular medication - did occur. Use statusCode "Completed" if the use occurred. [SDTM: CMOCCUR]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Captures information on the indication for administration of the concomitant medication item.
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @typeCode="CAUS"
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] observation
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="OBS" Observation (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 HL7ActClass)
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood)
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code
This observation SHALL contain zero or more [0..*] value
Information about the reason for the medication being taken. [SDTM: CMINDC]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] text
A text description of dosing amounts or a range of dosing information. [SDTM: CMDOSTXT]

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] consumable
Identifies and carries information for the consumable item that is being referred to.
Contains exactly one [1..1] Consumable Material (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.58)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Indicates a subcategory the concommitant medication substance administration is assigned to.
This entryRelationship SHALL contain zero or one [0..1] @typeCode="COMP"
This entryRelationship SHALL contain zero or one [0..1] observation
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="OBS" Observation (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 HL7ActClass)
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood)
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] value with data type CE
Provide the applicable concomitant medication sub-category value. [SDTM: CMSCAT]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] maxDoseQuantity
Information on the total daily dose of the medication. The structure also accommodates periods other than a day. [SDTM: CMDOSTOT] Note, this attribute can also be used if multiple total dosage amounts need to be reported.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @typeCode="REFR"
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] observation
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="OBS" Observation (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 HL7ActClass)
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood)
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code/@code="TBD" (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.3.26.1.1 NCI Thesaurus)
The code value indicates that the observation refers to the intended regimen for the substance administration.
This observation SHALL contain zero or more [0..*] value with data type ED
The observation value captures the intended regimen for the substance administration. [SDTM: CMDOSRGM]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Records the relationship between the start of consumption of the concommitant medication and a reference point defined for the study.
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Activity Start Timing Reference (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.55)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Records the relationship between the end of consumption of the concommitant medication and a reference point defined for the study.
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Activity End Timing Reference (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.54)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Used to indicate whether collection of data regarding an event of this type has been pre-specified, usually on a reporting form.
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Pre-Specified Event (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.66)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Used to capture information, most particularly the timing, regarding the collection of data for an event. This is relevant especially in cases where the timing and duration of an event are distinct from that of data collection.
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Data Collection (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.59)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Used to record the study days associated with the beginning and end points of an activity that may extend over a period of time.
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Study Day Period (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.70)

SHALL satisfy: The efective time attribute is used to capture information regarding the start, stop, duration and frequency of use for the concommitant medication. There shall be Two SXPR components created. The first will be an interval of time stamps (IVL_TS) to addres stop and start dates. Note, when duration is included, it is associated with either the stop or the start date. That is to say, only two of the three interval parameters may be instantiated, since, with two known, the third can be derived. The second SXPR component addresses the frequency of use. It uses the periodic interval (PIVL) type. Note, that this HL7 type tends to invert the usual expression. I.e. BID is expressed as every 12 hours.
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="SBADM" (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 HL7ActClass)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood)

SHALL contain [1..2] id
A sponsor supplied reference number for the concommitant medication. [SDTM: CMSEQ, CMSPID] A sequence number is required.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] text
A text description of dosing amounts or a range of dosing information. [SDTM: CMDOSTXT]

SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] statusCode
Used to indicate whether the activity - use of a particular medication - did occur. Use statusCode "Completed" if the use occurred. [SDTM: CMOCCUR]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] effectiveTime
Information on when and how oftern the concommitant medication was taken. Possible values include start date, stop date, and duration. Note, only two of these need to be valued, and only two values are supported. [SDTM: CMSTDTC, CMENDTC, CMDUR, CMDOSFRQ]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] routeCode
The route by which the medication is administered. [SDTM: CMROUTE]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] doseQuantity
The amount of medication taken at a single administration. [SDTM: CMDOSE, CMDOSU]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] maxDoseQuantity
Information on the total daily dose of the medication. The structure also accommodates periods other than a day. [SDTM: CMDOSTOT] Note, this attribute can also be used if multiple total dosage amounts need to be reported.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Group Identifier (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.63)
Allows capture of a group identifier for the concommitant medication information.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Indicates a category the concommitant medication substance administration is assigned to.

This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] observation
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] value with data type CE
Provide the concomitant medication category value. [SDTM: CMCAT]

This entryRelationship SHALL contain zero or one [0..1] @typeCode="COMP"
This entryRelationship SHALL contain zero or one [0..1] observation

This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood)
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] value with data type CE
Provide the applicable concomitant medication sub-category value. [SDTM: CMSCAT]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Non Performance Reason (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.64)
Provides a reason for not capturing information for the concomitant medication.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Captures information on the indication for administration of the concomitant medication item.
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @typeCode="CAUS"
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] observation
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="OBS" Observation (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 HL7ActClass)
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood)
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code
This observation SHALL contain zero or more [0..*] value
Information about the reason for the medication being taken. [SDTM: CMINDC]

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] consumable
Contains exactly one [1..1] Consumable Material (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.58)
Identifies and carries information for the consumable item that is being referred to.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Indicates a subcategory the concommitant medication substance administration is assigned to.
This entryRelationship SHALL contain zero or one [0..1] @typeCode="COMP"
This entryRelationship SHALL contain zero or one [0..1] observation
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="OBS" Observation (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 HL7ActClass)
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood)
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] value with data type CE
Provide the applicable concomitant medication sub-category value. [SDTM: CMSCAT]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @typeCode="REFR"
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] observation
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="OBS" Observation (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 HL7ActClass)
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood)
This observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code/@code="TBD" (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.3.26.1.1 NCI Thesaurus)
The code value indicates that the observation refers to the intended regimen for the substance administration.
This observation SHALL contain zero or more [0..*] value with data type ED
The observation value captures the intended regimen for the substance administration. [SDTM: CMDOSRGM]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Activity Start Timing Reference (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.55)
Records the relationship between the start of consumption of the concommitant medication and a reference point defined for the study.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Activity End Timing Reference (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.54)
Records the relationship between the end of consumption of the concommitant medication and a reference point defined for the study.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Pre-Specified Event (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.66)
Used to indicate whether collection of data regarding an event of this type has been pre-specified, usually on a reporting form.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Data Collection (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.59)
Used to capture information, most particularly the timing, regarding the collection of data for an event. This is relevant especially in cases where the timing and duration of an event are distinct from that of data collection.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Study Day Period (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.70)
Used to record the study days associated with the beginning and end points of an activity that may extend over a period of time.

SHALL satisfy: The efective time attribute is used to capture information regarding the start, stop, duration and frequency of use for the concommitant medication. There shall be Two SXPR components created. The first will be an interval of time stamps (IVL_TS) to addres stop and start dates. Note, when duration is included, it is associated with either the stop or the start date. That is to say, only two of the three interval parameters may be instantiated, since, with two known, the third can be derived. The second SXPR component addresses the frequency of use. It uses the periodic interval (PIVL) type. Note, that this HL7 type tends to invert the usual expression. I.e. BID is expressed as every 12 hours.

classCode="SBADM" moodCode="EVN"> <templateId root="2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.25.19"/> <id root="1532502909" extension="MDHT"/> <text>Text Value</text> <statusCode code="completed"/> <effectiveTime value="20120510"/> <routeCode code="1603114894"/> <doseQuantity/> <maxDoseQuantity/> <consumable> <manufacturedProduct classCode="MANU"> <manufacturedMaterial classCode="MMAT" determinerCode="KIND"/> </manufacturedProduct> </consumable> <entryRelationship typeCode="COMP"> <observation> <code code="386009501"/> <value xsi:type="CE" code="619173200"/> <entryRelationship typeCode="COMP"/>
